content.question: An object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is moving horizontally in a region where there is a resistive force <math alttext="F sub R equals negative k v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>v</mi></math>, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math> is a positive constant with units of <math alttext="Newton seconds per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>N</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> is in <math alttext="meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. The gravitational force exerted on this object is negligible. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> the object has an initial velocity <math alttext="v equals v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. What is the expression for <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> has units of seconds?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 0, end sub, times e raised to the fraction negative k, over m, end fraction times t, end power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></math>

<math alttext="v sub 0, end sub, times open parenthesis, 1 minus e raised to the fraction negative k, over m, end fraction times t, end power, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="v sub 0, end sub, times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction k over m, end fraction, times t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="v sub 0, end sub, times, open parenthesis, 1 plus the fraction k over m, end fraction, times t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub 0, end sub, times e raised to the fraction negative k, over m, end fraction times t, end power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
